channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Osaka World Expo Recalls a Faded Dynamism From Japan in 1970
item.description: The event is stirring memories of an exhibition in 1970, when the postwar Japanese economy was taking off and “you could have dreams about the future....

item.title: A Timeline of the Trump Administration’s Use of the Alien Enemies Act
item.description: Legal challenges over the powerful wartime law have gone all the way to the Supreme Court.

item.title: Southeast Asia’s Muslim market comes of age—and authenticity is in
item.description: From banking to fashion, local businesses are targeting a growing middle-class consumer base keen to buy 'halal'.

item.title: Can Trump Really Negotiate Peace in Ukraine, Russians Wonder
item.description: Many thought President Trump would be able to finish the war. Now they are not so sure.

item.title: Investors want to know what firms are spending more than earning
item.description: The hope is that their stance on big expenditures, like real estate or major machinery, will offer clarity into how they see the economy.

item.title: Firing Powell would hurt the dollar and U.S. economy, France says
item.description: “Donald Trump has hurt the credibility of the dollar with his aggressive moves on tariffs—for a long time,” French Finance Minister Eric Lombard said.

item.title: The Trump administration’s DEI rollbacks slashes stress-free zones for college students. ‘It feels like we’re going back’
item.description: The full scope of campus DEI rollbacks is still emerging as colleges respond to the Trump administration’s orders against diversity practices.

item.title: In Iran Talks, Trump Is Edging Toward Reviving an Old Deal
item.description: The two sides set an agenda for additional negotiations in the coming days, which could include technical details on uranium enrichment.
